Reviews.Title: “executive room stay”
Reviews.Author: akcostacruz
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed 1night in the executive room provided with a great service room changed upon request as needed proptly ,a large room with and very comfortable sitting enviroment. breakfast has a varied selection of tasty food, the hotel is in a great location local to nisantasi and taksim . overal a great over relaxing night stay for the both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Comment about my last trip”
Reviews.Author: teph m
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.Very nice rooms.Loved the service and the employees. Didn't like the system of putting the card in the thing to keep the light on.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. OK location”
Reviews.Author: alghannam
Reviews.Content: It is nice hotel , about 20 minute walking distance to Takssem St ( city center street) . the lobby is nice , active , I was in corner suet , it is really large suite with large bedroom, it can accommodate 4 people , two refrigerator , two TV, in term of view , I did not have a nice view , restaurant and shops are located near the hotel , breakfast is also good , but crowded

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaTh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 4 nights with my family a month ago. The staff are friendly and helpful There is a nice restaurant with beautiful view.We had a really good breakfast. it was open buffet The hotel is well situated and in easy walking distance to NisantasÄ± and Taksim They did not forget my mom birthday they prepared cake for her also it was complimentary. She loved it! We will absolutely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jose C
Reviews.Content: It's very convenient location for business trip. You can access to subway and travel quickly in the city (note that traffic is terrible in Istanbul). Friendly staff is +!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but with a bit too much heating”
Reviews.Author: estefanite
Reviews.Content: With so many reviews on this hotel, pretty much all has already been said. I will focus on some details which are I personally find of relevance. BED - Confortable for european standards, and seemed almost new. There are two pillows available for each guest, one with feather stuffing another anti-allergic so you can choose which one fits your needs best (or even take both!!). Note that for american guests, accostumed to have another matress for the basis of the matress one actually sleeps in, the bed may not seem as fluffy as the base is from flexible wood boards. I personamy prefer this model (as presented in this hotel) because it allows air to circulate under the mattress thus buildup of alergens. SMOKING - smoking is pretty big in Turkey and is allowed in almost all restaurants, cafes and public spaces. Also allowed in the hotel, so if are a non-smoker like myself, do remember to book for the non-smoking floor prior to arrival I forgot to do so and had to spend my fist night in one of the smoking floors so air quality was not so nice. WINDOWS - all windows open to allow refreshing the air in the room but this obviously means loosing sound insulation provided by the double glazing. And yes, the streets are pretty busy starting from six AM till over midnight so the trick is to leave the window open during the day as one goes out and ask the maid to keep it open. TEMPERATURE - there is central heating all over the hotel which made room temperature a little to high for the nice springly weather I was having there. Also i disrupted my sleep. Calling reception fixed the problem really fast, as immediatly tech support came to the room and closed the local dispenser of heating (water-based irradiator). Then room temperature could easyly be adjusted with the air conditioning (turning on the air-con while central heating was running had led to a mutual anihilation of effects... not productive). STAFF - very friendly, helpfull and fast in solving our difficulties with the room. Not ideal as travel guides, but then again, no one in this city seems to know the nubers of the buses going to a articular destination (not even turist information desks). BREAKFAST - wide assortment of cheeses and ham, but one must bear in mind that pork is not consumed here so ham and sausages are made from chicken or veal. Nice flavor and interestingly exotic. Also available eggs, scrambled or boiled, veggies (cucumber and tomato), fresh herbs (parsley and mint), fresh and jammed fruit and freshly squeezed fruit juices. Then of course the typical assortment of cereal, breads, muffins and croissants. Great start to the day! All in all i was very happy with the hotel and will certainly consider coming again.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for business, but not for tourism”
Reviews.Author: biancaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is jus one metro stop from Tacsim, which is an important business area and 5 minutes by taxi from the new sultan's palace. Apart for that, if you want to reach Sulthanamed or the Bazar area, it's not convenient by public transports. Taxis are quite cheap, but if you are in traffic, it can take quite a lot. Rooms are ok, good beds and good windows, so you don't hear any noise from outside. Breakfast was ok, nothing special. Wellness centre ok as well, but small. Generally it's a good hotel, but overall it's too expensive. All the staff was extremely nice and helpful, definetely the best aspect of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and easily accessible by metro”
Reviews.Author: FirasES
Reviews.Content: It is very close to a complex of congress centres and also a concert hall , that can be reached within 10 minutes by foot. A metros station (Osmanbey) is right in front of it and this makes mobility in the city, especially the old city, convenient. It is also very close from fancy shopping boutiques in the neighbourhood NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ±. The staff is friendly and eager to help. The rooms are comfortable and big. The flaws of the hotel are being located in a very busy street. Try to get rooms looking at the side street (Dolapdere street) they might be less noisy. In fact it is ok as long as you don't have to open the window. In my case I had to as the room was too warm. The Internet connection is also very slow and unreliable what would limit the convenience for business travellers who need constant access to Internet and e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “New Room, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: JoaoGuerra
Reviews.Content: Last time I was in Ramada plaza it was a mix of business and vacations. This time is was pure business and again the experience was fantastic because besides staying at a superior room like last time, I stayed in one of the front rooms over the entrance, which are really great with a wide living room with a separate area for working on your computer; and then a separate suite with a jacuzzi bathtub. Great for work and relaxation after a day's work. Service, as usual, was excelent. I used a lot of room service and food was very nice. I strongly recommend the hotel, both for business or vacations.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: nomad4838
Reviews.Content: nice location, not far from taksim suqare, nice breakfast , very well decorated rooms,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, attentive and caring management and staff”
Reviews.Author: KresoZg
Reviews.Content: When you stay in Ramada Plaza, you are safe, comfortable, and you can get any service you need. Safe because of two gentleman, Nihat Uysal (night manager) and Halili YalÃ§ain (head of security), who very patiently and professionally helped me in very embarrasing situation... I "lost" my iPad, and after detailed investigation, two gentleman found it in most unbelievable place! My very bad, of course. I couldn't thank them more than with almonds I got in local shop. All personell is very attentive and caring, service is perfect. Next time in Istanbul, Ramada Plaza is the only option!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Christer L
Reviews.Content: My wife came with me to a conference in Istanbul. The hotel is in a very nice part of the city with only a short walk to Taksim square with all the shopping and restaurants. However, if you like to go to the old town it takes some time using public transportation. The hotel has a very nice spa and pool area on the roof. We especially liked the lobby bar with its friendly bartenders where you can sit and relax with an evening drink or coffee. The service is taken very seriously. Our TV remote did not work. A repairman and an English speaking lady from the staff came immediately after our call and fixed it. Excellent breakfast that was included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in Istanbul with splendid service”
Reviews.Author: docgoyushova
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ramada Plaza during 5 days and found this hotel very comfortable, clean and perfect service and managment. Staff is very friendly, attentive, hospitality, caring, efficient and professional. Rooms are very clean, comfortable, equipped even kettle, so you can have a cup of tea or coffee any time (teabag and coffee are free). Bathroom is enough wide and very clean. I was so surprised when received hotel's present on my birthday, it was so touching ) And about location very close to Taksim, metro and bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience”
Reviews.Author: kedia_11
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased to share our experience of our Istanbul visit. And most of all Our experience in Hotel Ramada Plaza. Our stay has become memorable. We can not Help but to appreciate the cordial behavior and hospitality of Mr.Nihat Uysal night Manager Not only their service were excellent but the guide they provided us was superbly genuine. Their information of local market was excellent. This centrally located hotel was marvel in Many respect. We will definitely like to stay there in our entire next visit. We shall also refer my other friends to stay there. Thanks , S.K Kedia New Delhi,India

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ronit55
Reviews.Content: Again and again I'm going back to this hotel. No words for the level of services, the rooms, the breakfast and the smiles of everyone. For business people this is indeed a perfect place, close to the Metro and 5 min walk to Nisantase or Taksim But most of all, everyone at this hotel is there to assist, to take care and give us the "Best Customer Experience"

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza Istanbul with excellent management and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mehran t
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada plaza Istanbul on November 2011 for business purposes. The management of the hotel specially Mr. Nihat provided one of the best business services to my clients and I. The restuarant personel as well as the receiption were very friendly, caring and professional. I would recommend this hotel specially for businesses and meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent amenities and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mthereza89
Reviews.Content: Even though some of the rooms can be a bit small, the hotel is very good with a great spa, swimming pool, very good breakfast, nice bars and restaurants and great conference facilities. Free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Only because I had to...”
Reviews.Author: awfountain3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in Istanbul. It is right across the street from a metro stop and is in the heart of the business district. However, given the choice I will not stay there again. I only chose that hotel because it was booked through a conference. The hotel is very pretty on the outside and in the lobby, but looks can be decieving. On entering the hotel you must go through "security" and a metal detector. However, it is really for show since everyone "beeps" and are simply waived through to the rest of the hotel. While the hotel staff is friendly, they do so with their hand out for a tip at every turn; even asking for one for doing the simplist tasks. The rooms are adequate at best. The beds are hard pads on wooden slats, so sleepling for me was uncomfortable.The noise from traffic and the bar on the street side keep anyone from getting a good night's sleep. If you want a "non-smoking", be prepared for that to mean not lately; I could still smoke in all of the furnishings in my room. Don't expect a view either.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really noisy location”
Reviews.Author: ernesto61
Reviews.Content: The traffic noise stopped me getting a good night's sleep in my original room or the one I got moved to on request. As that's my number 1 requirement it's pretty hard to review well....... As you can see from the photo, this hotel is on a very busy junction, so I asked for a quiet room - high up and away from the elevator. I got the away from the elevator - but was right on the junction on the 4th floor and the traffic noise was constant. I asked for a quieter room and got moved up one floor and along a bit - to right next to the elevator and still next to the street!!!!! I don't hold the hotel responsible for the traffic noise (which if you know Istanbul is pretty noisy) so it must be that the hotel's sound proofing isn't up to the job. The staff are really good - friendly and helpful and there seem to be enough of them on reception and at breakfast. The rooms I've seen are big and have good facilities and are well cleaned and maintained, and as a Wyndham Rewards member there were a few added extras like some fruit and snacks waiting in the room. However, none of this will make up for disturbed sleep - I have another 2 nights to go and don't see the point in asking for another move as they would have already put me in the quietest wouldn't they?

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ugurbudak
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October...Its location was very convenienty for me since it is literally 15 meters from the Metro Station..Besides it is just on a walking distance to Taksim and NisantasÄ±..The staff was very good..I visited their bar , the time was a bit late..But when I told them I am hungry and didnt have a chance to eat anything due to my trips, they helped me a lot...The rooms are a little bit smallbut this something you can expect from a hotel in the middle of the city...Ohh before I forgot, do not leave your windows open in the night if you want to sleep..My room was on the back side of the hotel and overlooking to a Disco/Night Club which playing horrible music all night...But as soon as I closed the window there was no music..So the isolation was very well...

Reviews.Title: “A Very Easy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VermontTraveler21
Reviews.Content: Service: Excellent. Fast check-in and check-out. Everyone I met was friendly and helpful. Maid service was excellent. They would pop in the room whenever I stepped out to tidy or make up bed--even when I went to breakfast in the morning. Location. Great. Right across the street from a metro. Plenty of eateries and shops in neighborhood. A 15-minute walk Taksim Square. Room. I had a standard room with two single beds, which was small but adequate. TV was also small. Bathroom was modern and completely adequate. Windows were easy to open and close. AC/Heating unit was quiet--I didn't have to touch it. Breakfast: Buffet was substantial. Good selection of food, friendly waiters. I never had to wait long for the coffee or tea. I don't know if it's expensive because it was included with my room rate. Full honey comb was visually stunning and delicious. Delicious cherry juice. Pleasant Surprises: Full honey comb in the breakfast buffet. Wireless internet was free and one of the fastest I've experienced in a hotel. Bottled water complimentary in your room every day. Good pianist in the lobby bar. Unpleasant Surprises: None What makes this hotel unique: one of the fastest (and free!) wifi networks, condoms were included in the minibar (a selection of three types!). Exercise Room: Small but not bad. Clean. Some free weights. Cardio machines were all working. Would have like a water machine in the room. Nice view of city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghazi D
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at Istanbul Ramada Plaza Hotel during the period from October 13 to 18, 2011 Everything in the hotel was beautiful receptionists are always smiling rooms are spacious and clean.Free fast Internet. Restaurant prices are reasonable. Administration wonderful, especially Mr. Nihat Uysal the Nigh manager who is always eager for the comfort of the guests and their requests .He deserves all the respect and appreciation . Ghazi Dairi Jeddah Saudi Arabia

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahmed445
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Ramada plaza during my Istanbul trip,first of all location is ideal, steps a way from subway station , Hotel was very clear and the room was roomy and comfortable ,Breakfast was very nice good quality and friendly staff also reception staff were extremly friendly and helpful, i would definitly stay at this hotel again next time when i visit Istanbul maybe end of this month. Ahmed

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: T0_be_fair
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel during my business trip.The hotel is on a rush street (but I guess you can't expect quiet place when you visit Istanbul,its very live,fresh mega-city;) has a great connection to the subway its close to the business area of Istanbul which I appreciated the most.Rooms are clean,food was good,staff professional..actually there was nothing to moan about .Just maybe a little minus was the view out of my room..when you r looking for business class hotel I definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elyes B
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for 4nights end of August 2011 ...Stay was simply great ...Istanbul is a WONDERFUL city and Ramada Plaza hotel is just a great deal .....The location is ideal (Walking distance to Taksim, Sisli business district & shopping mall called "City" I guess), area is very safe, transportation is easy, service is great and staff are just wonderful and sooooooo friendly (thanks to the conceirge, doormen, security, Spa staff, housekeeping & front desk guys - Excuse me guys couldn't pick up your names!) ...Tried the pool at the roof top, it has great view and nice relaxing setting ...Tried also their Turkish Bath (The masseuse is a real pro & makes you feel really good - It was my last day and regret I couldn't tip her ...She highly deserved it ) ...Room service is also fine! In a few words: Highly recommended ...Great location ... WONDERFUL staff ...No bad surprise at all ...Another Positive point: Wi-fi free of charge ;) For sure, coming back again and again ...

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: gillprior
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a 4 night break and had such a lovely time. I was welcomed and made to feel at home. I had a executive bedroom and it was very very roomy and the bathroom was great. Plenty of toiletries including tooth paste, nail vansih remover, the normal shampoo and conditioner and also bath foam and shower gel plus all the other bits you get. Also there was a bowl of fresh fruit ever day when I came back to my room after it had been cleaned. There was also waiting for me a half bottle of white wine, some nuts, dried fruit and chocolates waiting for me when I arrived as i was arriving after 10pm, this was a lovely touch. The one thing i would say is the breakfast selection is much better in the main restaurant rather than the lounge set aside for the executive rooms. Also they need to put some sort of fitment onto the bedroom doors and they slam shut and if there are people in the rooms beside you having an early start and you are wanting a lie in this can be very annoying! I kept my window shut and could not hear any noise at all and the ac was brilliant so really had no need to have my window open at night. I had 2 hamam massages and they where 1st class (I had one at the Swiss in Istanbul 2 weeks earlier and the ones at the Ramada where much better) OK you dont have the luxury of the Swiss changing rooms etc etc but the treatments are brilliant. I used the sun bathing area and that also was fine, a little bit wondy with being on the top of the hotel but the breeze was welcoming. All in all I would stay at this hotel again with no hesitation, the service, room, food etc was 1st class. And what also was nice was I was greeted by name at all times so I wasnt just a person staying at the hotel I was Miss Prior!!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mark f
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay at the Ramada hotel & thought to write a review for those of you that are planning to visit this beautiful & historic city of Istanbul & looking for a descent hotel to stay .Ramada Is located In Taksim area at the center of Istanbul & provides many advantages to a visitor some of these Include; -Less than 50 feet from the underground train station that just for a dollar you could go to any part of Istanbul as well as all shopping malls within the city. -A short walking distace to any shops such as bakery ,money exchange ,restaurants ,pharmacy ,supermarkets ,liquor store & any stores you could possibly Imajine. -The hotel staffs are very accommodating & pleasent to deal with . -The hotel managements are very professional & go out of their way to assist you & one manager In particular by the name Mr.Nihat uysel ,even gave me a ride to the airport & thought It was wonderful to receive such service which I never expected to receive & never have to any country that I have traveled In the past 20 years . -The breakfast was wonderful & I highly recommend to have breakfast Included when you make your reservation .It Is the most complete breakfast which provides everything on the food groups ,fruits ,cereals ,meats ,pastries eggs & more . I could go on & on writing about this hotel & the advantages that offers ,but you have to experience It for yourself by just staying there .I love Istanbl & Its people & never get tierd of visiting this beautiful city with all Its mysteries & excitments .I wish you a nice trip & hope that you enjoy this city as much as I have .

Reviews.Title: “Good business and family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Damascene48
Reviews.Content: Reception staff are very friendly and helpful, and you can get the daily Turkish papers either in English or Turkish complimentary at the reception desk. The room is spacious, with free tea/coffe. The room has a drawer which you can buy directly practical things for travellers on the move, such as deodorant, socks etc. for both genders. The standard room comes with you fine cotton bathrobe. Facing the hotel is both a metro station which can take you all the way to the Istanbul's Ataturk International airport (you need to change 2-3 stations). Many authentic Turkish restauarants are around the hotels and you can a decent cooked and tasteful Turkish meal for as little as US$ 10. You can also enjoy a Turkish bath on the top floor (for a reasonable price) or enjoy the Sauna room for free.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing place to enjoy"”
Reviews.Author: Tigger294201
Reviews.Content: excellent location, near to every where, friendly staff, cozy and comfortable facilities around the place, highly recommended to stay in with your family

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ronit55
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in this hotel quite frequently due to my business in Turkey. From the minute you step into the hotel, the curtsy of the bellboys, the welcome smiles at the reception, the understanding of the needs of the business traveler is AMAZING. The room are clean and large, sunny. The breakfast is fantastic, served with smiles. The Metro is just across the street, and Nisantase around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Corporate Style Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OleDunk
Reviews.Content: Standard business stay type hotel. Room reasonable size and clean. A little road noise but double glazed windows do prevent most noise from the busy road outside. Decent coffee shop in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Nice”
Reviews.Author: Saleh_DM
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel for a conference, the first time to come to European-Asian country. The location was good. Its appearance was antique with hotel staff welcoming smile. After a long flight, I directly had a sleep and it was wonderful. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. But the bathroom was separated with a transparent glass wall that we could see through. The food was delicious, but sometimes I went to some restaurants near it.

Reviews.Title: “five star executive staff but not first choice location”
Reviews.Author: liviustan
Reviews.Content: I stayed together with my wife, for bussiness in this hotel in march 2011. The hotel is located far enough from the old city with main attractions. Taksim square is conveniently located. The most close attraction is Dolmabahce Palace. The rooms are big, correct for a five star hotel with all the features needed. The hotel does not have a swimming pool but a great sauna and a gym. The restaurant is OK and breakfast is perfect. The people from main desk or concierge/ breakfast are well trained. They could arrange for hotel taxis, important thing because in Istanbul you can be easily fooled by dishonest taxi drivers who speak only Turkish. The beautiful lady manager ressponsible for client service is always there in the morning asking people about service quality. The only bad thing happend (first time for us in so many countries visited) a hotel employee entered our room and stole from my wallet which was into a backpack and not the room safe but only for a short time. I reported the situation and I got surprised the staff solved the situation very quickly and discreet. They apologized telling us the guy was newly employed and not sufficiently verified. They gave our money back together with a fruit basket and a wine bottle, the manager wanted to assure that we are pleased, in a word they acted as they should: quietly, discreet and efficiently. If you need a five star convention center and you are not so interested in city attraction this hotel is perfect but if you are a tourist first time in this beautiful and different city maybe you could choose a hotel near the Bosphorus in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, with big nice rooms and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: JoaoGuerra
Reviews.Content: I went for a mix of a business trip with a Family long weekend, and for both purposes it was perfect. Good central location, very nice areas and service, and some unexpected treats like a nice welcome fruit meal in the room at 2.30a.m. just after arriving from a long trip. I really recomend this place and I surely will be coming back soon, both for business and for leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing after every long day trip”
Reviews.Author: PinkRosesN
Reviews.Content: Went with my father, August 2008 , the hotel was booked through a local travel agency . Stayed in a twin bed room ( not sure whether it was deluxe or standard ) but was a deluxe for us :) Comfortable beds, Comfortable space , was roomy enough, international TV channels, including English and Arabic, free tea and coffee, with water heater, and fridge with paid drinks, didn't try them . The view of our room was the worst thing about it, looked at the next building wall and windows. Internet wifi is free of charge. Worked nicely in lower floors but not in higher ones, but it works well in the lobby . The lobby , very charming atmosphere, had coffee one night at the bar, the waiter offered a free complimentary cake, and it was just yummy ! I loved the pieces played by the piano player which varied in mood between cheerful but not noisy at all, and clam soft but not sad . It was nice to set in the lobby at mornings waiting for our tour bus and observing Istanbul wake up and watch people harrying up to their works and shops open for a new happy day :) The receptionists, bellboys were all cooperative and very friendly. Touristic magazines in the room were very helpful. Metro station was only a few steps away ! Very convenient for people used to metro systems. The neighborhood was very sophisticated. Yet there were plenty affordable shops of all kinds, supermarkets, groceries, boutiques , electronics, restaurants, simply everything was around. Taksim square was only a couple of minutes away !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service. Recommend everyone. We'll be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: zubeyir
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel 8 nights with our 2 little kids (8 and 5). Our experience was fantastic. The hotel staff was so polite and friendly. They loved the kids and often spoil them with hot chocolates and lollies. They were so helpful if we have any problem. They did everything to make our stay comfortable and they were successful. The hotel location is fantastic, just above the Osmanbey metro station. It is close to historic precinct and bosphorus as well as Taksim(for night life) and Nisantasi (for shopping!). The room was very clean and had everything we needed. The hotel also has a roof top swimming pool and spa, turkish bath, sauna, gym. massage etc. The internet was free and fast. The breakfast was included and one of the best open buffet we had. Plenty of choices and staff always running around asking if we have any special request (omlets, turkish tea etc). One more detail.. There is a Gloria Jeans at the entrance. My wife loved to have Gloria Jeans handy because she loves it in Australia so it was good to have a familiar shop and accustomed latte taste for her :) Great value, great staff, great hotel. Recommend everyone from business to families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Location not great”
Reviews.Author: Chibi64
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel. Room was great. Location good for the subway but not so good for the tram, street car, or ferries. Not close to old city. Close to convention center (walking distance) near the Hilton. Charge for an internet connection in the room seemed high, certainly not free.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, comfortable facilites and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dennis_valenza
Reviews.Content: This trip combined business with pleasure. The hotel staff, from bellmen to concierge were most friendly and helpful. In particular, Ms. Sentop and Ms. Mahmutoglu at the guest relations desk made wonderful recommendations and arrangements for tours and provided very helpful tips that enhanced our enjoyment and appreciation of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is one city i wanted to visit again”
Reviews.Author: MuhammadMubashir
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my colleagues to Turkey and planed to saty in Ramada Plaza Hotel in Istanbul. when we reached there it was ealry monrig and every one was busy in work. I was very impressed to see the courtesy and hospitality from hotel staff specially one of their guest relationship manager. Due to this our stay remained very comfortable and relaxing. Hotel staff was always there to help us and assist us. I intend to travel agian to Tureky and will stay in same hotel with my family next time. Regards, Mubashir

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Muscatsally
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. Our room was a bit small and could have done with more closet space for two people. We had a minor problem with the airconditioning and this was attended to promptly. The breakfasts were superb. The staff were amazing. My wife had her handbag stolen at Waikiki store across the road from the hotel. The staff at Ramada Plaza were amazing, they took us to the Police Station in a taxi at their cost, took me to a pharmacy to replace my glasses that were in my wifes' handbag, phoned our bank to cancel our credit cards, gave us refreshments and sent fruit and a bottle of wine to our room. They also paid for us to make an International call so that we could ask family to send us some money. Big kudos to Ayca Sentop (Guest relations Exec) and Nihat Uysal (Night Manager) the General Manager Savas Kutkan also came to see us personally to find out if he could do any more. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: alexandra_antonia
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice and has a good location. the food is great and they serve really nice desserts!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, but an average hotel on the whole....”
Reviews.Author: Adam099
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Ramada Plaza on a chilly evening in Istanbul. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a jovial bellboy who took my suitcase to reception on the second floor via escalators. Check in was trouble free, and I was even upgraded to a room with a "king size" bed as I informed the clerk that I would much prefer a comfortable double bed instead of a single. The bellboy took me to my room and explained the basics, breakfast from seven to ten, room service, spa etc.etc. and would not leave the room without a tip in hand. The double room on the executive floor (6th) was fairly spacious, with a nice view of derelict housing over the road and the road below. Unfortunately, the bath/ shower was dirty, so I had to clean it before being able to use it as room service didnt answer. The bed is quite uncomfortable, the mattress having seen better days. Entertainment on the computer screen/ tv in the English language is extremely limited to say the least (mainly BBC news) unless you are willing to pay dearly to watch a movie or listen to music. Mini bar is average, yet again, exorbitantly priced, as are room service food and laundry services. After finally falling asleep in the early hours, I was suddenly woken by the Moazin calling the faithful to prayer at six in the morning. This mosque was using Rolling Stones grade amplification, so dont forget to close your windows ! Breakfast selection was fair, with basic salads, eggs, pastries etc. served on buffet basis. Again, if you want that small espresso for breakfast instead of the dull coffee served, get ready to pay that pretty penny again for this "extra"..... I would personally class this hotel in the three star region for business travellers, yet as it is so centrally located, this would be considered a 4 star "location- location-location!" class hotel for tourists. There is a spa / sauna etc. in the hotel, but I was too cold and tired to try it out and maybe a good massage would have made this short stay a little more pleasurable. I would therefore recommend the Ramada for short business stays and possibly for tourists due to its central location.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS A NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: saeedkarimi
Reviews.Content: Eyery thing is good @ there, we had no problem there and breakfast was great. It is in ISTEGHLAL st, near TAKSIM sq and this is an advantage for travelers who want to access these places. i enjoyed! our travel was in autmn and unfortunately we could not use pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: shaz621
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a business trip. We were extremely impressed with the friendly and helpful service offerred by the staff. The food at the restaurant is excellent, and there is a wide range of selections at the breakfast buffet. The staff at the restaurant is very courteous. We were also very happy with the guest relations staff. We had one half day available for sightseeing, and the guest relations lady gave us recommendations and very clear directions that allowed us to easily get to the old city area using the public transportation system. The rooms were very nice and modern, and they were also very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We were each pleased to find a fresh fruit plate and complimentary wine in our rooms when we arrived. It was just the thing to make you feel refreshed after the stress of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff - V good Hotel- V good Location”
Reviews.Author: Joula
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel; Reception staff and restaurant staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Rooms are excellent. Location is great - just few stept away from the Metro Station - one stop away from Taksim. Food is Very good - to Excellent housekeeping is average. Pool is pleasant but small. Spa is clean but small.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising service”
Reviews.Author: thomsonkl
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for myself and my partner, who for work reasons couldn't make it. I had booked a room at the lowest internet rate for two people. On my second morning there, the receptionist (not the one who checked me in) addressed me by name, and then proceeded to tell me that they'd noticed that I'd come alone but was paying for two people. He then offered to call reservations to see if they could adjust the rate to single occupancy from that night on. Given I'd booked the cheapest, non-adjustable rate I didn't think I would be able to adjust anything. It was fantastic and surprising service, they were so proactive. The hotel staff overall were incredibly helpful and I enjoyed my stay there immensely. The bedroom was large and the bed very comfortable. There was a welcome fruit bowl and biscuits in my room when I arrived (welcome after a 30 hour trip). The toilet was oddly placed in the bathroom, but I think that was the only thing that bothered me about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: SushNam
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, Its right next to the osmanbey metro Station so you can take the Metro to taksim ..however a walk down the road to Taksim square would take you approximately 20 mins and its a nice walk as well. Liked Breakfast is real real nice ..They have a huge selection of cheeses fresh bread and all sorts of Jams. The Room is very comfy Location is good if you want to shop around Istiklal Street The Service is very classy and always helpful. The helped us to get a taxi to the old city for 15 Euros. Turkish Bath is a definite To do in this hotel ..its free for the guests. Disliked The bathroom is really tiny. The wireless internet(free) is dead slow The Tv reception is horrible ( Maybe it was just our room ..and we didnt lodge a complaint as we hardly watched TV)

Reviews.Title: “Just luxury, not service”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the first part of my last trip to Turkey. I can say that this is luxurious hotel with business class rooms, very beautiful and modern; however, everything is about luxury and not about service. For me, when travelling, the service, attention and details take the first place. I couldn't feel that the Ramada Plaza offered those things to me. On the other hand, it is far more expensive in all senses. The location is good for those looking for staying around the Taksim area but not for enjoying the historical and traditional sights of Istanbul. Finally, from my room there was no nice view to appreciate, only old residential buildings around the hotel. From my experience, it is possible to find much better hotels in Istanbul for less price.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: arsemia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ramada Plaza Istanbul for 3 nights. Although it is a five-star hotel, you don't feel any stars at all. The staff is mainly not quite hospitable and educated. Breakfast is made up of low-end, cheap selections of food. What I understand from a hotel in this class is a moderate-to-premium service and atmosphre. At Ramada Plaza Istanbul you don't get the worth of your money. I would recommend nearby Hilton ParkSA or Bentley Hotel instead of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of my heart”
Reviews.Author: fditrani
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel rigth in the heart of Istanbul, few steps from the metro to go down towards the Bosphorus

Reviews.Title: “Good city Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedroMelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a busy avenue that goes to Taksim square its not in the old city or near the turist atraction, but is very close to the new convention center and military museum!!! nearby (in the back streets) thereÂ´s some narrow and shady streets that at nights have some peculiar customers and services.... but in the day time thereÂ´s no absulute problem!!!! thereÂ´s a metro station in front of the hotel (Osmanbey station). the hotel has nive acumudations and friendly staff, a good cafeteria (starbucks alike) with cosy atmosfere and good coffe, a plesant loby bar with live piano music. good business center and few shops (mainly for weeddings.....) the rooms are good, classic/regular style, with space, clean, and confortable. with a normal view of the avenue bellow. On the top floor they have a swimming pool with sunbeds (that closes at 6/7 pm... so early!) and a turkish bath and sauna, as well a small gym!! i think its a good city center hotel, very confortable and near to the convenction center.

Reviews.Title: “Boring and mediocre”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraNairobi
Reviews.Content: The word that springs to mind in reviewing this hotel is boring. nothing really good, nothing really bad. room is clean. nice bathroom. reception is not so welcoming. water is not really hot. got non-smoking room while i did not want to. breakfast is outrageously expensive. pool was not open anymore. wifi in room was rather tedious, so decided to pay for high speed acces only for a day, more was too expensive. noise levels were within limits. good coffee shop on ground floor but cappuchino is about US$ 7 !!!! metro stops next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: MIchkoM
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for business travelers. Room was big enough, internet access, nice bathroom, all the amenities in the room. Staff was very professional and friendly. Not far from Taksim Square if after your meetings you want to walk around a bit and see the city. Room was quiet and very clean. Breakfast was pricey, though. Make sure your company has a Corporate Rate otherwise the prices are rather high.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Plaza Istanbul Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Halaskargazi street, no:63 | Sisli, Istanbul 34373, Turkey
